intro: Bobua austrosinensis, commonly known as the Australian bobua, is a flowering plant native to the wet tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Bobua austrosinensis is often found in coastal and rainforest habitats, where it thrives in humid, well-drained soils.
